member.name: T:winapp2ool.settingsHandler
member.summary: settingsHandler provides an interface for winapp2ool modules to serialize some of their settings to disk using a familiar ini interface

member.name: P:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.settingsFile
member.summary:
A copy of winapp2ool's user configurable settings that was read from disk
Its contents overwritten with the contents of the settingsDict whenever settings are changed

member.name: P:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.settingsDict
member.summary:
A more nicely accessible structure for accessing module settings
Keys in the primary dictionary are module names, the value dictionaries are simple key value pairs where the key is the name of a setting and the value is the state of the setting

member.name: P:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.saveSettingsToDisk
member.summary: Indicates that changes to the application's settings should be serialized back to the disk

member.name: P:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.readSettingsFromDisk
member.summary: Indicates that settings who are read from the disk should override the corresponding default module settings

member.name: M:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.saveSettingsFile
member.summary: Saves the winapp2ool settings to disk

member.name: M:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.updateSettings(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the disk-writable representations of the application's settings as the user makes changes to them
member.param: The name of the module who owns the setting being updated
The name of the setting being updated
The updated value held by the setting

member.name: M:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.loadSettings
member.summary: Looks for the settingsFile and attempts to load it from disk. If the settingsFile is empty, settings will be loaded from their default configuration

member.summary: Loads all module settings into disk-writable representation in the form of both an iniFile and a Dictionary

member.name: M:winapp2ool.settingsHandler.serializeModuleSettings(System.String,System.Action,System.Action)
member.summary: Creates the disk-writable representation of a module's settings, either by generating their default values or by assigning values given from a previous session to the current values
member.param: The winapp2ool module whose settings will be either instantiated or read from disk
The function who creates the in-memory representation of the module's setting in the absence of a version on disk from which to read them
The function who assigns values from disk to the current active session of a module's settings

Exiting a menu returns exactly one level up in the stack to the menu that called it

Prints menu lines, options, and frames fit to the current console window width The type of menu information to print
0 : Line
1 : Option
2 : Option with a "Reset Settings" prompt
3 : Box with centered text
4 : Menu top
5 : Option with an Enable/Disable prompt
The text to be printed
When is 1 or 5, contains the name of the menu option
When is 3 , contains the name of the module whose settings are being reset The description of the menu option
Optional, Default: "" Indicates that the line should be printed
Optional, Default: True Indicates that a blank menu line should be printed immediately before the printed line
Optional, Default: False Indicates that a blank menu line should be printed immediately after the printed line
Optional, Default: False Indicates that the printed text should be centered
Optional, Default: False Indicates that the bottom menu frame should be printed
Optional, Default: False Indicates that the top menu frame should be printed
Optional, Default: False A module setting whose menu text will include an Enable/Disable toggle
